sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
By the Lords Justices and Council. Mich. Armach. C. Granard. Whereas by proclamation dated the 20th. of June 1685. for the reasons therein expressed, we did strictly require and command every captain, or in his absence, and other officer in chief of the militia within this kingdom, ... to call for and gather together all the fire-arms appertaining to his troop ... Ireland. Lords Justices and Council. Granard, Arthur Forbes, Earl of, 1623-1696.
3 sheets ([3] p.).
Printed by Benjamin Tooke, printer to the Kings most excellent Majesty, and are to be sold by Andrew Crook, at His Majesties Printing-house on Ormonde-Key, and Samuel Helsham at the Colledge-Arms in Castle-street, Dublin : [1685]
Title from caption and opening lines of text. Imprint from colophon. At end of text: Given at the Council-chamber in Dublin, the 16th. day of October. 1685. Recites proclamation 20 June 1685, and the means employed to enforce it ... -- Steele. Steele notation: Arms 185. or ther 2) they 3) be- We. Wing I748 title reads: By the Lords Justice and Council. Whereas by proclamation . . . [16 October 1685]. Reproduction of original in the British Library.
=======
By the Lords Justices and Council. Mich. Armach. C. Granard. Whereas by proclamation dated the 20th. of June 1685. for the reasons therein expressed, we did strictly require and command every captain, or in his absence, and other officer in chief of the militia within this kingdom, ... to call for and gather together all the fire-arms appertaining to his troop ... Ireland. Lords Justices and Council. Granard, Arthur Forbes, Earl of, 1623-1696.
3 sheets ([3] p.).
Printed by Benjamin Tooke, printer to the Kings most excellent Majesty, and are to be sold by Andrew Crook, at His Majesties Printing-house on Ormonde-Key, and Samuel Helsham at the Colledge-Arms in Castle-street, Dublin : [1685]
Title from caption and opening lines of text. Imprint from colophon. At end of text: Given at the Council-chamber in Dublin, the 16th. day of October. 1685. Recites proclamation 20 June 1685, and the means employed to enforce it ... -- Steele. Steele notation: Arms 185. or ther 2) they 3) be- We. Wing I748 title reads: By the Lords Justice and Council. Whereas by proclamation . . . [16 October 1685]. Reproduction of original in the British Library.
the Kings most excellent Majesty
Andrew Crook
Samuel Helsham
Benjamin Tooke
His Majesties Printing-house on Ormonde-Key
the Colledge-Arms in Castle-street
